meanings.definition: To make changes or corrections to something
meanings.sent1: She revised her essay to fix the spelling mistakes.
meanings.sent2: He always revises his work before submitting it.
meanings.sent3: The teacher revised the test so many times, it started to look like a coloring book.
meanings.sent4: His approach to problem-solving revised the way we all thought about challenges.
meanings.sent5: The artist revised the painting until it captured the perfect mood.

meanings.definition: A new version of something that has been updated or improved
meanings.sent1: The revised edition of the book includes new illustrations.
meanings.sent2: I prefer the revised version of the software; it runs much smoother.
meanings.sent3: The chef's revised recipe for lasagna became an instant hit at the restaurant.
meanings.sent4: The revised model of the car had better fuel efficiency than the original.
meanings.sent5: The revised design of the building made it more energy-efficient.
